tn.text: Yahweh continues speaking to Moses.
"you must give them" or "you must tell them"
Yahweh tells Moses his laws for the people of Israel.

tn.ref: If he came by himself, he must go free by himself
tn.text: What "by himself" means can be stated clearly. Some languages require that the additional condition, that he marries while a slave, be stated clearly. AT: "If he became a slave while he had no wife, and if he marries while he is a slave, the master need only free the man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"alone" or "without a wife"
"if he was married when he became a slave" or "if he came as a married man"
"clearly says"

tn.ref: I will not go out free
tn.text: "I do not want my master to set me free"
"put a hole in his ear"
a pointed tool used to make a hole

tn.ref: for the rest of his life
tn.text: "until the end of his life" or "until he dies"
"has chosen"

tn.ref: he must let her be bought back
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "he must allow her father to buy her back" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"has no authority to sell"
"he has deceived her"
"chooses"

tn.ref: he must not diminish her food, clothing, or her marital rights
tn.text: This can be stated in a positive form. AT: "he must give the first wife the same food, clothing, and marital rights she had before" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
"take away" or "reduce"
This includes things that a husband must do for his wife, including sleeping with her. AT: "and he must continue to sleep with her as before" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
"hits" or "attacks"

tn.ref: that person must surely be put to death
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you must certainly execute that person" or "you must certainly kill that person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: did not do it with premeditation
tn.text: "did not plan to do it" or "did not do it on purpose"

tn.ref: I will fix a place to where he can flee
tn.text: The purpose of choosing a place can be stately clearly here. AT: "I will choose a place that he can run away to be safe" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"after thinking carefully about it"
The word "him" refers to the one who killed his neighbor.
This can be stated in active form. AT: "so that you can kill him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Whoever hits his father or mother must surely be put to death
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "If anyone hits his father or mother, you must surely put him to death" or "You must surely kill anyone who hits his father or mother" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"must certainly"
"with him"

tn.ref: that kidnapper must surely be put to death
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you must certainly kill that kidnapper" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Whoever curses his father or his mother must surely be put to death
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you must surely kill anyone who curses his father or his mother" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "cannot get out of bed" or "has to stay in bed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"gets better"
This is a stick that can be leaned on for support while walking.
This refers to a situation when someone cannot work to earn money. You can express this clearly in the translation. AT: "the time he could not work" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"pay his medical costs" or "pay for his costs for healing" (UDB)

tn.ref: as a result of the blow
tn.text: "because of the injury" or "because his master hit him"

tn.ref: that man must surely be punished
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you must certainly punish that man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: for he will have suffered the loss of the servant
tn.text: You can express clearly in the translation that the servant was valuable to his master. AT: "because he has already lost his servant who was valuable to him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"her baby dies in her womb" or "her baby is born too soon and dies"

tn.ref: the guilty man must surely be fined
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you must certainly fine the guilty man" or "the guilty man must pay a fine" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"what the judges decide"

tn.ref: you must give a life for a life, an eye for an eye
tn.text: This means that if she is hurt, the person who hurt her must be hurt in the same way. AT: "he must give his life for her life, his eye for her eye" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Here "man" refers to the owner of a slave.
"as payment." Compensation is what someone does for another person or gives to another person to make up for what he has caused that person to lose.
"injures with its horns"

tn.ref: the ox must surely be stoned
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you must stone the ox to death" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: its flesh must not be eaten
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you must not eat its flesh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the ox's owner must be acquitted
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you must acquit the ox's owner" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: its owner also must be put to death
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you must also kill its owner" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: If a payment is required for his life
tn.text: If the ox's owner can pay a fine to save his own life, then he must pay whatever the judges decide. The full meaning of this can be stated clearly. This can also be stated in active form. AT: "if the owner of the bull can pay a fine to save his own life, he must pay the full amount that the judges say that he must pay" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"has injured with its horns"
"330 grams of silver." A shekel weighed eleven grams. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bmoney]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "you must kill the ox by stoning it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"uncovers a hole in the ground" or "takes a cover off a hole in the ground"
The owner must be paid for the loss of his animal. AT: "pay the owner for the dead animal" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

The one who paid for the loss of the animal will become the owner of the dead animal and can do what he wants with it. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "will belong to the owner of the pit" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"divide the money" or "divide the money they receive"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "if people knew" or "if the owner knew" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: a habit of goring in time past
tn.text: "had gored other animals before"

tn.ref: its owner has not kept it in
tn.text: This means that the owner did not keep his ox securely inside a fence. This can be clearly stated in the translation. AT: "its owner did not keep it inside a fence" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: he must surely pay ox for ox
tn.text: The owner of the ox that killed must give an ox to the man who lost his ox. This can be stated clearly in the translation. AT: "the owner of the ox that killed must surely give a living ox to the owner of the ox that died" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
